instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message:
Hi, I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B board with no charger lights and no signs of life. I have <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> present. No water damage but has had a replacement SSD.

DCIN is 15.15v on a 45w charger & 16.61 with an 85w charger

<RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> is measuring 14.61v on all 4 pins

I'm stuck.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message: Need green light on charger first. What is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage? Is there 3V present on middle pin of charger when connected?

[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message:
I think the charger went crazy when I moved the board.

I'm getting around 0.4v on the middle pin.
On <DIODE>D7005</DIODE> pin 1 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> i get .04v

Sorry for the fuck up before

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message: Okay, a light reflow of the SMC and I seem to have 3.3v on the middle pin of the charger, 8.6v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3.3v on <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message: Still no signs of life or lights on the charger though

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message: So this is a liquid damage then. First thing now is to try a known good IO board and cable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message:
I have a brand new IO board that I have tested with but I've got the ribbon connector on order.
Don't suppose the 13" air version ribbon could be used to test with could it? I know it isn't the same shape but I have one to hand is all.

I have found that if I plug the charger into another mac and get a light, then switch it to this one, weirdly I can get an orange light.
Also light or not, if I hold the power button for 5-10 seconds it powers up and displays fine but the fan is full speed and the battery isn't being seen.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message:
Inspect cable and connector for corrosion. No idea if the 13" would work, compare the pinout of the connector between 3435 and 3437. 
The battery not being recognized does not bode well for the SMC I'm afraid.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message: Finally received the new IO board connector.. made no difference. Connector seems fine, I'll take another look around the SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message: Give the SMC some flux and heat, do not reflow, just heat it up and let it cook with flux.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger lights - no power
threads.message: Replaced the SMC chip and its all good now.
